line_1: Yet spite of all that Nature did
line_2: To make his uncouth Form forbid,

line_1: So on that fatal Day you did
line_2: You of your Memory was rid,

line_1: "'Twas so for me that Edwin did,
''Twas so for me that Edwin did,
The British Pallas! who, as Homer's did
He car'd not what the Footmen did:
line_2: Her Maids She neither prais'd, nor chid:

line_1: So, Men of old, to gain Renown, did
line_2: Build Babel with their Tongues confounded.

line_1: And tell me how good children did;
line_2: You used to smile and stroke my head,
Nor what the dreaming Sages said:

line_1: The rats by night such mischief did,
"'Twas so for me that Edwin did,
